intro: Engelhardia fenzlii, commonly known as the Fenzli's Engelhardia, is a rare and unique species native to southern Africa. It is a woody shrub or small tree that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features small, ovate leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, and it produces small, woody fruits that contain a single seed. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a botanically significant and ecologically important species.
